import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
%matplotlib inline
import seaborn as sns
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore")
source.38d100fd:
#Finding the rows having missing values

missing_values_df = df[df.isnull().any(1)]
missing_values_df
source.aa23f930:
# Dropping the rows of mising values

df_1 = df[df.Industry.notnull()]
df_1.head()
source.155a6327:
#Plotting countplot for Total number of industry

plt.figure(figsize=(15,5))
ax = sns.countplot(x = "Industry", data=df_1, order = df_1["Industry"].value_counts().index, palette= "twilight")
plt.title("Total Number Of Startups in Industry", fontsize=(20))
plt.xlabel("Industry", fontsize=(20))
plt.ylabel("Frequency", fontsize=(20))
plt.xticks(rotation=90);

for p in ax.patches:
    ax.annotate(f'\n{p.get_height()}', (p.get_x()+0.15, p.get_height()), ha = "center", va="bottom", color = "black", size=12)
plt.show()
source.87d30755:
#Barplot to how valuation of top 10 countries
plt.figure(figsize=(20,5))
bx = sns.barplot(x ="Country",y ="Valuation", data = con_val, palette = "twilight")
plt.title("Valuation of top 10 countries", fontsize=(20))
plt.xlabel("Country",fontsize=(20))
plt.ylabel("Valuation", fontsize=(20));

for index, row in con_val.iterrows():
    bx.text(row.name, row.Valuation,round(row.Valuation,2), color="black", ha="center")
